The claim made by Rep: Sean Casten: "From 2000 to 2016, every major drug that was introduced came out of NIH funding."
The peer: reviewed study that found NIH funding contributed to scientific findings underpinning every one of the more than 200 new drugs approved by the FDA over the timeframe it covered.
The correction made to Casten: s claim, stating that the correct date range for the study is 2010-2016, not 2000-2016.
The context of the claim: which was made in the context of advocating for a plan to lower prescription drug prices and increase public funding for new drug research.
